title: Theory CS Club, ISI Kolkata
text: We organise reading groups, seminars, problem sessions, and informal discussions on algorithms, complexity theory, logic, and related fields — open to everyone from beginners to advanced students.

title: Talks & Videos
text:
Below is a selection of talks organised by the Theory CS Club. Each card contains a short abstract and links to materials.




Introduction to Computational Complexity and Turing Machines


Speaker: Rudrayan Kundu, MStat 1st Year

In this talk we give a brief introduction to the models of computation and Turing Machines and how that does not matter. We define the classes P and NP based on our definition of deterministic turing machines.


<a href=“href=”materials/TM_Notes.pdf”>Slides (PDF)

NP-Completeness Crash Session


Speaker: NAME · Level: Intermediate


Classic NP-complete problems such as SAT, 3-SAT, Vertex Cover, Clique, and Independent Set, with an emphasis on how to structure reductions between them.



Session notes


Problem sheet


Recording (YouTube)


Related reference





Automata & Regular Languages


Speaker: NAME · Level: Introductory


Deterministic and nondeterministic finite automata, regular expressions, closure properties, and examples connecting automata with contest-style problems.
